sections.label: PDF Processing
sections.description: Controls how PDF documents are converted to text

parameters.label: Use Marker for PDF
parameters.tooltip: Enable Marker for advanced PDF conversion to Markdown. Provides superior quality for complex PDFs with tables, equations, and multi-column layouts. Processing takes 2-5x longer than standard extraction.

parameters.label: Marker Output Format
parameters.tooltip: Controls Marker's output format. Markdown is recommended for RAG ingestion as it preserves structure for chunking.

parameters.label: Marker Use LLM Processors
parameters.tooltip: Enable LLM-powered hybrid processors for complex regions like tables, equations, and diagrams. Significantly improves extraction quality but increases processing time.

parameters.label: Marker Paginate Output
parameters.tooltip: Include page number markers in Marker output for document provenance tracking. Enables citations back to original page numbers.

parameters.label: Marker Force OCR
parameters.tooltip: Force OCR processing on all PDF pages. Use for PDFs with garbled or problematic embedded text. Processing is 10-20x slower than standard extraction.

parameters.label: Marker Strip Existing OCR
parameters.tooltip: Strip embedded OCR text and re-OCR with Marker. Use when existing OCR quality is poor, common in low-quality scans.

parameters.label: Marker PDF Text Workers
parameters.tooltip: Number of parallel workers for PDF text extraction. More workers increase processing speed but use more CPU and memory.

parameters.label: Marker LLM Model
parameters.tooltip: LLM model used by Marker for table extraction and complex layout analysis when 'Marker Use LLM' is enabled. API key must be configured in OPENAI_API_KEY or MARKER_LLM_API_KEY environment variable.

sections.label: Entity Extraction
sections.description: Controls how entities and relationships are extracted from text

parameters.label: Enable Entity Extraction
parameters.tooltip: Master toggle to enable entity and relationship extraction from documents. Creates entity nodes in the knowledge graph and enables entity-aware retrieval.

parameters.label: Enable Gleaning
parameters.tooltip: Enable multi-pass entity extraction with conversation history. Improves entity quality by allowing the LLM to refine extractions across multiple passes.

parameters.label: Max Gleaning Passes
parameters.tooltip: Number of additional gleaning passes after initial extraction. 0 disables gleaning, 1 is recommended for most documents, 2 for high-value technical content.

parameters.label: Entity Extraction Format
parameters.tooltip: Entity extraction output format. Tuple format provides robust extraction and token efficiency.

parameters.label: Tuple Format Validation
parameters.tooltip: Enable strict validation of tuple format output structure and field requirements. Recommended for production to ensure data quality.

parameters.label: Tuple Max Description Length
parameters.tooltip: Maximum character length for entity and relationship descriptions. Prevents token bloat while maintaining sufficient context.

parameters.label: Enable Description Summarization
parameters.tooltip: Enable LLM-based summarization of accumulated entity and relationship descriptions. Provides 50-70% compression and deduplicates repetitive information.

parameters.label: Summarization Min Mentions
parameters.tooltip: Minimum mention count required to trigger summarization. Only descriptions mentioned N or more times are summarized, filtering low-value content.

parameters.label: Summarization Min Length
parameters.tooltip: Minimum character length to trigger summarization. Avoids summarizing already-concise text, saving processing time.

parameters.label: Summarization Batch Size
parameters.tooltip: Number of entities or relationships to summarize per LLM call. Larger batches reduce API calls but use more tokens per request.

parameters.label: Summarization Cache Enabled
parameters.tooltip: Enable SHA256-based caching to avoid re-summarizing identical descriptions. Reduces redundant LLM calls and processing time.

sections.label: Graph Persistence
sections.description: Controls how entities are persisted to Neo4j

parameters.label: Enable Phase 2 NetworkX
parameters.tooltip: Enable NetworkX intermediate graph layer for batch persistence. Provides 5-10x faster ingestion through batch processing. Experimental feature.

parameters.label: Neo4j UNWIND Batch Size
parameters.tooltip: Maximum number of entities to persist per Neo4j UNWIND batch transaction. Larger batches reduce transaction overhead but use more memory.

parameters.label: Max Nodes Per Document
parameters.tooltip: Maximum entity nodes allowed per document. Safety limit to prevent memory issues with very large documents.

parameters.label: Max Edges Per Document
parameters.tooltip: Maximum relationship edges allowed per document. Safety limit for relationship count to prevent memory exhaustion.

parameters.label: Importance Score Threshold
parameters.tooltip: Minimum importance score to include entity in graph. Acts as quality filter, with lower values including more entities but potentially reducing quality.

parameters.label: Strength Threshold
parameters.tooltip: Minimum relationship strength to persist. Filters weak relationships, with lower values creating more connections but potentially adding noise.

sections.label: OCR & Image Processing
sections.description: Extract text from images and scanned documents

parameters.label: Enable OCR
parameters.tooltip: Enable OCR processing to extract text from embedded images in documents. Increases processing time by approximately 20-30% per document.

parameters.label: OCR Quality Threshold
parameters.tooltip: Minimum confidence score to accept OCR results. Higher values ensure better quality but may skip low-confidence text.

sections.label: Performance & Limits
sections.description: Control API usage, concurrency, and resource limits

parameters.label: LLM Concurrency
parameters.tooltip: Maximum number of concurrent LLM API requests during ingestion. Higher values speed up processing but may hit rate limits.

parameters.label: Embedding Concurrency
parameters.tooltip: Maximum number of concurrent embedding API requests during ingestion. Higher values speed up processing but may hit rate limits.

parameters.label: LLM Delay Min (seconds)
parameters.tooltip: Minimum delay in seconds between LLM API requests. Helps avoid rate limiting with exponential backoff.

parameters.label: LLM Delay Max (seconds)
parameters.tooltip: Maximum delay in seconds between LLM API requests during exponential backoff. Caps retry delays.

parameters.label: Embedding Delay Min (seconds)
parameters.tooltip: Minimum delay in seconds between embedding API requests. Helps avoid rate limiting with exponential backoff.

parameters.label: Embedding Delay Max (seconds)
parameters.tooltip: Maximum delay in seconds between embedding API requests during exponential backoff. Caps retry delays.
